item.title: Covid: Surgery waiting times could be cut with specialist hubs, say surgeons
item.description: Surgeons in England want specialist sites for non-urgent operations delayed because of the pandemic.

item.title: Insurers must not penalise loyal customers, says FCA
item.description: People renewing their home or motor insurance will pay no more than new customers from January.

item.title: Belarus: Russia blocks some flights for avoiding its ally
item.description: Air France and Austrian Airlines routes to Moscow are halted as Russia rejects new flight plans.

item.title: Patrisse Cullors: Black Lives Matter co-founder resigns
item.description: Patrisse Cullors says her exit is nothing to do with "right-wing attacks that tried to discredit my character".

item.title: Nike says it split with Neymar over sexual assault investigation
item.description: The sportswear giant and Brazilian footballer give conflicting accounts of why they parted ways.

item.title: Cumberland Infirmary patient 'dropped' from operating table dies within weeks
item.description: A hospital confirms it is investigating "an incident involving a patient in one of our theatres".

item.title: Covid: 21 June lockdown easing date not guaranteed - Kwasi Kwarteng
item.description: Some scientists suggest the reopening date should be delayed until more people are fully vaccinated.

item.title: Germany officially recognises colonial-era Namibia genocide
item.description: Foreign Minister Heiko Maas asks for forgiveness for atrocities and announces financial aid package.

item.title: Covid-19: PM backs Matt Hancock over Dominic Cummings' care home claims
item.description: The health secretary denies claims he misled the PM at the start of the pandemic about testing.

item.title: Ryan Giggs appears at crown court accused of coercive control
item.description: Ryan Giggs is accused of deliberately headbutting ex-girlfriend Kate Greville and controlling her.

item.title: Barack Obama praises Marcus Rashford in Zoom meeting
item.description: Former US president gives his backing to footballer and anti-poverty campaigner Marcus Rashford.

item.title: Sandwell Bitcoin mine found stealing electricity
item.description: Police say they raided the building thinking they were going to find a cannabis farm.

item.title: Newspaper headlines: Doubt over lockdown easing as Hancock faces pressure
item.description: Friday's papers focus on warnings from the prime minister as fears grow over the Indian variant.

item.title: County lines: The search for vulnerable children
item.description: The BBC's Angus Crawford joins police as they look for vulnerable young people involved in county lines.

item.title: Canary Islands: 'Taking in migrants changed my life'
item.description: A British businessman has turned his Canary Islands hotel into a home for migrants from Africa.

item.title: Brighton artist turns coma hallucinations into graphic novel
item.description: Zara Slattery had vivid hallucinations during a medical coma while fighting a flesh-eating bug.

item.title: Harambe: Gorilla photo to be sold as an NFT five years after he was shot dead
item.description: Memes and vigils were sparked worldwide when the western lowland gorilla was shot dead five years ago.

item.title: The teenagers fighting India's deadly Covid crisis
item.description: Suhani and Prabhpreet are part of a team who find and verify what resources are available for families in need.

item.title: Cicadas: The US chef cooking up the insect 'flavour bombs'
item.description: Billions of cicadas have emerged in the US and Brooklyn cook Joseph Yoon is making good use of them.

item.title: Angry, upset, relieved - Covid bereaved families on Cummings claims
item.description: After Dominic Cummings' testimony on Wednesday, some bereaved by the pandemic are asking: what if?

item.title: Taiwan must choose between virus and politics
item.description: The island is desperately seeking vaccines - but must decide whether to accept China's offers of help.

item.title: Glasgow: The city that has been locked down for nine months
item.description: People in Glasgow have been enduring some of the strictest restrictions in the country since last autumn.

item.title: The looming battle over abortion in the US
item.description: Pro-choice groups say many restrictions have been introduced in states across the US this year.

item.title: In Tarun Tejpal acquittal, judge questions 'appropriate' behaviour for rape victims
item.description: A judge clears Tarun Tejpal of rape, noting the alleged victim appeared to be "in a good mood" afterwards.

item.title: Does the UK have highest Covid death toll in Europe?
item.description: The total is the largest but for deaths per 100,000 people the UK is no longer top.

item.title: Drones and live-streams: How tech is changing conservation
item.description: Around the world, animal conservation has evolved so it's not just humans monitoring wildlife.

item.title: 'Fortress Australia': Why calls to open up borders are meeting resistance
item.description: Many Australians are loath to relax border controls despite experts warning of the harms of isolation.

item.title: 'Thank you, Andrea' - Juventus sack manager Pirlo after one season
item.description: Juventus sack Andrea Pirlo as manager after he spent just one season in charge of the Italian club.

item.title: A 'phenomenal mistake' or will Osaka's decision to not speak to media prompt change?
item.description: Naomi Osaka is not speaking to the media at the French Open to protect her mental health - will her move change anything?

item.title: Watch: Prince William takes Extreme E car for test drive
item.description: Watch as Prince William gets inside an Extreme E car for the first time and puts it through its paces.

item.title: MLB: Chicago Cubs steal a run in bizarre fashion against Pittsburgh Pirates
item.description: Watch Pittsburgh Pirates' Javier Báez get into a mess between home and first, allowing Willson Contreras to come home and steal a run for the Chicago Cubs much to his teammates' amusement.

item.title: 'We've earned it' - Noel Gallagher on Man City's Champions League chances and Guardiola friendship
item.description: Famous Manchester City fan Noel Gallagher tells BBC Sport about promises from City's owners, conversations with Pep Guardiola - and City's chances in the Champions League final.

item.title: Covid vaccine: How many people in the UK have been vaccinated so far?
item.description: The logistics of vaccinating millions of people across the country, as more than 38 million people receive at least one dose.

item.title: Covid vaccines and rare clots - what you need to know
item.description: We take a look at why these unusual clots happen and when they occur.

item.title: What are the new rules for social distancing?
item.description: Guidance on hugging close friends and family has being relaxed in England and Scotland.

item.title: What are the rules for travelling to green, amber and red list countries?
item.description: Foreign holidays are now possible, but travellers must follow strict rules on their return.

item.title: Covid: Should I be working from home or going back to the office?
item.description: As lockdown restrictions ease gradually across the UK, what are the rules about returning to work?

item.title: Children tell of neglect, filth and fear in US asylum camps
item.description: The BBC has uncovered allegations of cold temperatures, sickness, lice and abuse, through a series of interviews with children and staff at US detention camps for children.

item.title: Rafael Nadal: The 'tough love' that shaped a 20-time Grand Slam champion
item.description: From 'scaredy cat' to a 'raging bull', Rafael Nadal's transformation into a true tennis great has a lot to do with one man in particular.

item.title: Martin Bashir inquiry: Diana, the reporter and the BBC
item.description: The full story of how the BBC's Martin Bashir got his 1995 interview with Princess Diana - and what happened next.
